    Aaron Gothard Portfolio

    Aaron Gothard is a budding engineer with a passion for fabrication. His talents lie in the design, analysis, and communication of innovative ideas

    My Projects

    Work Experience

    1. Junior Design and Manufacturing Engineer

      Trimteck LLC • Coral Springs, FL
      July 2025 – Present
      • Wrote SOPs for manufacturing processes to ensure compliance to ASME B16.34, PED 2014/68/EU, and other industry standards
      • Made and submitted application for Module H certification under the Pressure Equipment Directive (PED) 2014/68/EU (Pending)
      • Designed Severe Service valves with multi-stage trims and advanced flow characteristics for high-pressure applications
      • Led company-wide research to eliminate failure modes and improve product reliability

    2. Makerspace Technician

      The Wond'ry at Vanderbilt University • Nashville, TN
      May 2022 – May 2025
      • Designed parts and molds for training VUMC nurses
      • Facilitated personal and professional projects for Vanderbilt Faculty and 400+ students
      • Mentored and advised senior and student design teams through the design process
      • Orchestrated workshops to teach design principles, rapid prototyping, laser cutting & 3D printing

    3. Manufacturing Intern

      Graham Packaging Company • Bowling Green, KY
      May 2023 – Aug 2023
      • Installed and troubleshot 2 new blow-molding lines for manufacturing
      • Performed bottle profiling and qualification using GMP
      • Collaborated with industrial engineers to optimize production workflows
      • Assembled technical documents, interface control sheets, and value stream maps for manufacturing processes

    Let’s Build Something

    I’m always interested in meaningful engineering work, collaboration, and opportunities to learn.
